website_summaries.verdict: A fun, twisty fidget toy for people of all ages to deal with boredom or stress.
pros: Fun and easy to use, these fidget toys capture users’ attention quickly
Can be pulled apart and all 3 assembled into 1 large fidget toy
Durable enough to last for years
cons: Pieces when popped apart are small enough to be swallowed
Come in random colors – some enjoyed more than others

customer_reviews.title: All the fidget!
customer_reviews.text: I have generalized anxiety disorder and major depressive disorder. I discovered these at the counter of a Bordrs Books when I was about 10. They helped me through some of my hardest days, just fidgeting around with them relieved stress and helped calm me. Then I lost mine. Now, at 26, I have found these again on Amazon! I can't believe it! And they're just as fun, addicting, and relaxing as they were when I was a kid. Twist it, bend it, make it in to a snake. The possibilities are endless, and so much fun.
customer_reviews.author: E&E0715Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for teaching Science concepts!
customer_reviews.text: I teach High School Biology, Anatomy and Physiology, AP Bio and PLTW-BMS. I've used tangles for years as a demo for polymers/monomers, proteins and amino acid, as well as protein structure. I would even tape a pair to the skeleton to show how as one muscle contracts the opposite muscle relaxes. But until now all I had was solid gold Tangles. Now with these multi-color Tangles I can mix and match my Tangles and really show my visual learners abstract scientific concepts. The best kind of Science Geek Toy!
customer_reviews.author: Mj

customer_reviews.title: Great for *anyone* who needs to keep his/her hands occupied and can be taken anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Simple, quiet fidget toys for kids and adults alike. Bought this set for 3 three-year-olds (one autistic) who had to sit through a graduation ceremony. Three bright and fun color combinations to choose from. The pieces can be taken apart but this isn't so easy for a toddler to do, which is good (wouldn't want the parts to get lost, or worse, eaten). These are very easy for children to hold, yet small enough to throw in a purse for fidget/boredom emergencies. I need to get some for myself!
customer_reviews.author: sweettems

customer_reviews.title: Great Fidget Toy for Adult Students
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the fidgets for my adults students to use during class discussions and lectures. Some of the students commented that the fidgets were fun to use and that they appreciated having something to hold and work with while sitting in class. I have also used these fidgets with preschoolers. With the younger children, the fidgets came apart easily. The children seemed to enjoy them until they came apart.
customer_reviews.author: rfshell

customer_reviews.title: Twitch Toys for Tots
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my small daughters as they tend to pick at their hands when they are stationary (watching TV or resting). They end up hurting their cuticles and I hate the risk of infection. This is seriously a wonderfully cheap solution to the problem. Even if they are not actively twisting the item simply holding it between "twisting times" helps stop the picking.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Burns

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for trichotillomania
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these and a larger Tangle for my 7 year old daughter who suffered with Trichotilomania (pulls eyelashes out when under stress). They have helped to keep her hands busy when she is bored which helped divert her attention from picking her eyelashes. They are another tool in our tool box to help ease the stress that she can sometimes feel. I like how you can snap apart the pieces and make the Tangle smaller for little hands to grab easier. I would recommend this for anyone who suffers from anxiety and feels the need to constantly be doing something with their hands.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Mom

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1 minute after use
customer_reviews.text: I work with special needs children and these broke after about 1 minute of play. They can be snapped back together but I wonder how many times I can do this before they totally break. I would not recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Lutzke

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: I am a 23 year old person with ADHD, an anxiety disorder, as well as being on the autism spectrum. I am very easily stressed out and overwhelmed, as well as require a constant need to stim from the moment I wake up til I fall asleep in bed. My stims were beforehand, pulling out my hair, scratching myself, or cutting my fingers on sequins from how aggressively I'd rub them. This very easily replaces all of those harmful stims in a positive manner and is small enough to easily carry around without being stared at. These are an essential need for me and I couldn't recommend them enough!
customer_reviews.author: S Hansen

customer_reviews.title: The twisty, curvy colorful addicting toy, what should I do with my hands, thingy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband because he often spends a lot of time talking to clients. Although he usually is working on his computer at the same time, I thought these would be a nice distraction if he was just sitting and talking. But when they came, three to a package, I decided he didn't need all 3 and took one for myself. I've really enjoyed turning and twisting it in some many ways and sometimes throw it in my pocket to have while watching TV or talking on the phone. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer geribowriter

customer_reviews.title: Really fun and useful
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a "fidget" for a 4 year old who had difficulty staying focused long enough for us to read a book to him, even when we used animation, voices, etc. He loves these! I explained that they are to hold while we read, "when your hands just really want to move." He sits for a story now, hands busy with the fidget but watching and interacting with the book.
customer_reviews.author: Jan M.

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget for ADHD
customer_reviews.text: Great fidgets for ADHD. I work with kids, and I have found these are awesome if they struggle with anxiety, ADHD or other mental health issues that make it difficult to focus. I would recommend for any kid that needs to be doing something with their hands. Great in particular for a school accommodation as it doesn't make noise or distract other kids
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Joints keep separating
customer_reviews.text: The joints keep separating. An adult can push it back in, but a small child lacks the strength and coordination. I bought this for my son as a fidget toy, so he would stop biting his nails. I thought he could keep it with him throughout the day, but since I cannot be with him all the time, he would 'break' it at one of the joints and then just toss it aside. it didn't even survive as a toy for a day because after I reattached it a few times and he separated it a few more times, he lost interest. He still bites his nails. sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfberry

customer_reviews.title: Fun and helpful
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this assortment of tangle fidgets. I gave them as stocking stuffers to my grandchildren, none of whom really require fidgets but who enjoy playing with them. I would have given 5 stars, but found that one of the kids twisted a little hard and broke her's apart. We were able to fix it and still use it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Some pretty fantastic toys
customer_reviews.text: Something for me to have in my hands when I'm anxious! I like being able to twist something around and around and not worry about it knotting up. Sometimes I prefer the smooth ones to the textured ones, but there are times when I am especially anxious and the textured ones are the better option. I have found many times that I think more clearly when I have one of these in my hands, because then I'm not so focused on how much I need to have something in my hands. My hands always need to be doing something!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: I’m SUPER happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I’m SUPER happy with this product! I bought these tangle fidgets from two other sellers in the past and was super disappointment. These ones are perfect for 3 main reasons: Their size is perfect for adults size hands which is hard to find (also fits children). It’s very smooth and not rough, meaning it doesn’t get “stuck” when you use it. The connecting parts connect strongly so the ends don’t disconnect even when you use it intensely. Very high quality as well as wonderful colors. I would definitely buy them again in the future from this seller. Thank you for a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Svetlana Toder

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: I received 3 of the Tangle Jr fidget toys for my autistic grandson. It is smaller than I thought it would be, but it's good for his small hands. Everyone in the house has been playing with one of these since 3 came in a set. They are fun, twist and turn every different direction. Keeps hands busy. The only thing I would suggest is trying to make the set of 3 different colors. I received 2 of the same colors and with autistic children, you just never know what is going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: These are great. I bought the set because I destroy things ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I bought the set because I destroy things at work if I don't play with something in my hands. My coworkers know me as the guy that fiddles with that little noodle thing all day. My wife plays with it whenever she is stressed out and it seems to help. I like them. My only complaint was that after playing with it for about a month, one of the links broke and I had to remove it. Otherwise they are great!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wurtzel

customer_reviews.title: Successful in many areas and age groups
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased three of these before that were a bit larger. One was for an adult with autism Another adult with early onset Alzheimers and one for my 2 year old grandson. They were great calming devices for the adults and the 2 year old would fidget with it at nap time until he fell asleep. I am thinking of getting some for my daughter who works with youngsters in a classroom setting who have ADHD. I think they might be effective in that arena as well. I highly recommend these items. My 8 month old grandson is delighted with them also.
customer_reviews.author: grandma Chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid Anxiety Tools
customer_reviews.text: I use this as part of an anxiety tools basket for my work as a therapist. It is very commonly one of the first gadgets my clients turn to. They can connect them all or create different images using 1, 2, or 3 of the toys. They’re very helpful tools in that setting!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviews have said they are really tiny
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews have said they are really tiny. Which personally I did not have a problem with because they are used for my kids in places like the restaurant or when we are waiting. So being small so they aren't as noticeable is really a great point and a reason why me and the kids liked them. That is where the like of them stop. They are very fragile and I would not recomend them for children that don't understand their own strength. In less that three months my kids snapped two of the three. Which they weren't even being all that rough with them just doing what you are supposed to do with them and snap broken.
customer_reviews.author: Raina

customer_reviews.title: The children in my classroom enjoy using these as "fidgets" or objects to help them ...
customer_reviews.text: The children in my classroom enjoy using these as "fidgets" or objects to help them learn when they feel fidgety. The pieces can come apart, but are easily snapped back together. We set guidelines before utilizing the Tangle Jr.: - Fidgets help us learn and complete our task. It must be put back if it becomes a distraction or used as a toy. - Fidgets are to be left in the classroom. I have a range of various fidget toys, and these are the most popular/are checked out first. I would not mind having more for the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Dink

customer_reviews.title: Not the best build construction
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three that I bought broke within a few days of my children playing with them under my supervision. My children were playing nicely and I was quite surprised at how easily these broke. VERY disappointed. But, even as a wiggly worm instead of a ring, these are fun for my boys and so IDK, could have been worse. Overall quite nice and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High price for easily destroyed item
customer_reviews.text: These fidgets are a great idea, but are too easily pulled apart and parts lost. Having to supply materials for my own classroom, I want something that is going to last longer than a day or a week. Save your money and get something that is not going to be so easily destroyed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fidget!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome. I have ADHD and Asperger's and this really helps relieve restless energy and helps me focus. It also helps me calm down when I am nervous, anxious, irritated or angry giving me a place to channel out my emotions. Helps me calm down when I am overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: AEB

customer_reviews.title: ... these for my special needs son and they are awesome! Not only are they perfect for his baby ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my special needs son and they are awesome! Not only are they perfect for his baby hands to hold onto, these would also be great for anybody who has anxiety who might want or need something to fidget with in their hands. Doesn't make noise and moves around easily between the fingers
customer_reviews.author: Curly Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not for kids with  special needs and oral fixations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a 9 year old child with autism. I wish this was more difficult or impossible to take apart. My son fidgets with it, pulls them apart, then sticks the small pieces in his mouth. If your fidgeter also has oral fixations, this is NOT the toy for you. It may be a good fidget toy for an adult, but it is very, very difficult to put back together and I have gouged the skin on one of my fingers trying to get an individual piece back in place.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Isbill

customer_reviews.title: I immediately came online to find them and came across a set of 3 for a great price. I kept one for my house
customer_reviews.text: I found this product when my son's physical therapist brought this to my house one day. My son who at the time was only 13 months old played with this for 10 minutes straight which was a huge plus. I immediately came online to find them and came across a set of 3 for a great price. I kept one for my house, gave one to my parents to keep, and gave one to a friend who has a lil one. My son is now almost 3 and he still plays with this toy trying to figure out how it works. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Robin C

customer_reviews.title: Recommended age wrong in Product Description.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a 1-year-old's birthday gift, based on the recommended age listed in the product description of "over 3 months." When the toy arrived, the packages are clearly labelled "Choking hazard, not for children under the age of 3 years." Now I will need to go out and find a different gift, the night before the party. Very disappointed. Product Details Product Dimensions: 2.8 x 1.8 x 2.8 inches ; 1 pounds Shipping Weight: 3.2 ounces (View shipping rates and policies) Origin: China ASIN: B0034EKP8Q Manufacturer recommended age: 3 months and up
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Lepik

customer_reviews.title: Have one of these in my car and fidget with ...
customer_reviews.text: Have one of these in my car and fidget with it when I catch myself getting angry with traffic, and now that I think about it, it helps me to keep my hands off of my phone while driving as well (your results may vary). They're really somewhat therapeutic, and I've since given the other two to my friends after they threatened to steal the one I keep in my car. Might have to reorder to get some more to give to friends who deal with loads of stress on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: These are fun and distracting (in a good way) for any kid ...
customer_reviews.text: These are fun and distracting (in a good way) for any kid got adult. My oldest, who I originally bought them for, pulled one apart so I do wish it was linked better somehow (on the other hand, he did have to exert a lot of energy into achieving that). Also, has pictured three items in different colors and all three of mine were the same color, so a bit disappointed in that. Overall though, it's what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Static Momma

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I have not purchased these on Amazon yet, but they are on my wish list. Tangle Jr.s are great for fidgeters or anxiety. They are durable, easy to clean, small enough to fit in a pocket or bag, big enough to keep your hands busy without it being a huge distraction to the person using it or to others. I have them on my wish list to use in my special education classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love these, but fragile
customer_reviews.text: Love this for fidgeting, but disclaimer, if you're not really gentle with them and disconnect and reconnect often, they WILL break. One of mine only lasted 1 week before breaking 2 segments, and since then, I've broken two more.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Little disappointed that I ordered 2 sets of 3 and ended ...
customer_reviews.text: Little disappointed that I ordered 2 sets of 3 and ended up with 3 of the exact same color..really? You have hundreds of choices and this is how it came, but we have always like the tangle, keeps him calm, just the 3 like colors were purple and pink, not what a 13 year old boy wants to being playing with. Great toy though, do recommend for anyone with a child that has nervous tendencies.
customer_reviews.author: Doolie

customer_reviews.title: Cool product! I don't want to return it
customer_reviews.text: I only received 1 of the set of 3. Cool product! I don't want to return it. I just would like my other 2. What do I do?
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Trich and Anxiety!
customer_reviews.text: As someone with trich and anxiety, these were recommended to me by my therapist. They have helped immensely. They keep your fingers busy, and it’s easy to distract yourself with them. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Versatile for ages, little pieces coming apart hard for travelling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a keep-them-busy toy for road trip and flights. My kids are 2 and 5 and they both enjoyed them, but not for too long at a time. I should have read the description better because I didn't realize they come apart into little pieces. My little tinkerer took them apart immediately when I was really hoping he would truly just fidget with them, and them little sister saw it taken apart and has to get in on that action. Oh well, still a great toy, just not as convenient I'm little pieces for travelling!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: A fun toy for everyone, including my grandmother!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore these. My grandmother does too. I gave her one of them and she carries it around with her everywhere and just loves to play around with it. This makes me really happy because sometimes she has trouble with her fingers. They're just plain fun to fidget around with and I love mine too. Makes a very good distraction toy from pain (I just had leg surgery.) Thank you for making them!
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for fidgeting/busy small hands!
customer_reviews.text: I teach preschool and have a lot of fidgety children. This is the age where you encourage them to keep their hands in their laps so their fingers aren't up their noses or in other unhealthy places. This toy is perfect for these kids to hold in their laps at group time to turn and twist. It's silent, small, and fulfills their need to wiggle! I keep one at home as I'm always fidgeting and it is an awesome thing to have laying around. They are also durable- the parts can pop apart and easily pop back together again. I just ordered a second set. Great value and great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Clicky sounds - not good for misophonia
customer_reviews.text: I have misophonia, which, for the purposes of this review, means that people who click their pens or tap-tap-tap drive me insane. Not mildly irritated, but somewhere between enraged and mega-panicky, depending on my mood at the moment. So I bought these little toys for my co-workers, who are supportive yet fidgety. I decided to go with these because I saw a review that specifically said that they are totally silent. They are not silent. They make clicking noises as the pieces touch each other. Plus, my co-workers say that they are not satisfying to fiddle with.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great! Loved them as a kid growing up
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my nephew, kept one for my son & I. Im 21 years of age and I love to use it at work calms my nerves. I probably like it more than my son but he is just 1 year. My nephew likes it from what I was told. I bought it as a sensory toy.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are fun to play with. I really didn't know what they did but got them for my girls for a car trip. Turns out they don't really do much (I thought it might be like a puzzle), but they are fun to manipulate. You can twist them and turn them into all sorts of ways and before you know it you've been sitting there playing with this colorful little thing for some time. So as far as a "fidget toy," total win :)
customer_reviews.author: JenJen

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Stress-Relief Toy
customer_reviews.text: I first ended up seeing one of my communications professors have some of these and recommend them. Once fidget spinners started becoming a thing I decided to buy more stress-relief toys. This one is probably one of my favorites and has helped with calming me down and distracting me from thinking about things that just make me more upset. While people say it's more of a bad thing that these things can get pulled apart, at least it can be a distracting challenge to piece them back together, then you forget you were ever mad or sad in the first place, at least for minor things from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They break easily, but I'm pretty rough with them before they ...
customer_reviews.text: These have been my fidget toy of choice for years. They break easily, but I'm pretty rough with them before they do, so maybe not as easily as they would if a kid was playing with them. They are quiet, brightly colored, and fit in a backpack easily. Not really great for shoving in a pocket though unless you're a guy with big pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Horger

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a 3 pack - you can keep ...
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a 3 pack - you can keep one on each floor of the house! I bought for my son who always has his fingers in his mouth when we sit at night reading books before bed. I thought he'd play with these instead to keep his hands occupied. Worked for about a day but back to fingers. The product itself is perfect - just didn't work for what I intended it for.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are a lot of fun for both kids and adults to fidget with. They are a smaller size and will easily fit in a pocket or purse so it's easy to take along. Helps keep hyper kids quiet for a little bit, usually. Colors are nice and product seems sturdy enough to last a while. Great for a lot of ages; maybe age 2 on up to adult.
customer_reviews.author: Janet B.

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Great fidget-er, even for adults. My daughter enjoys this when she reads or is simply sitting somewhere bored because you can really twist and turn it into many different shapes. My pops visited and since he's a fidget-er himself, I got him one since he enjoyed my daughter's so much. He still enjoys manipulating it and wrapping it around his fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! They are easy to take apart but
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! They are easy to take apart but, a tiny bit hard to connect. They are made of a shiny plastic and very light to hold. It fits right back in the box. It's small enough to take with you and play with one or two hands. It keeps me busy so I don't drive my mom crazy in the car. We can't wait to try it with homework (we just started school and don't have any yet.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These make a good fidget toy- I use it myself while lifeguarding
customer_reviews.text: Get a three pack- the sections on these toys break. These make a good fidget toy- I use it myself while lifeguarding. But I'm pretty calm and gentle, and still I lose a section a week. This wouldn't keep me from buying again, but I probably will not be getting thaws for my special needs students in the fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I got them for my husband and he loves them! He is losing his sight and can't take notes in class anymore, so he gets very fidgity and bites his nails. Ok, this is not my business. But not, whenever we're talking or listening to an audiobook he is biting his nails to the point of bleeding, so I figured this would help keep him occupied and take some of the anxiety away. it is also quiet and small enough that he can use it in class without disturbing anyone. I love them and I have one for me , which will be perfect on the plane to calm my nerves.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun toy! I play with it everyday. This is a perfect toy for everyone. The pieces don't seem to break apart easily, like the other reviews stated. If the pieces do come apart, you can easily just put them back together. The size is perfect for a small hand. This toy helps me focus. It is also very fun to play with when you have nothing to do. I totally recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like the colors—too garish for a toy meant to relax fidgety kids. The toys were very small. I was expecting a larger size toy. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: sycamore joan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These are great products for calming oneself. Equally impressive when used in Occupational therapy to get one's hand movement going better and smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Coan

customer_reviews.title: I bought these as I was stocking up on sensory ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as I was stocking up on sensory toys for our son with adhd. They are nifty enough for him to fiddle with.....we keep them in his "calm down" tent when he needs a cooling off period.
customer_reviews.author: monique

customer_reviews.title: Fun , sturdy and fidget-able!
customer_reviews.text: Fun way to keep little hands busy on car rides. Fun for all ages to play with. Gave one to great grandma to keep her arthritic fingers moving.
customer_reviews.author: Mouffette

customer_reviews.title: Funny little device
customer_reviews.text: These are colorful and well made. They are such a simple little thing but everyone who sits in my office plays with them. I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: These are good, but beware
customer_reviews.text: These are good, but beware, they do come apart. They also do not make any sound. That can be a good thing, but not as stimulating for children with sensory issues as the ones that click. Our daughter keeps breaking them apart, but she can't get them back together. It is not as helpful as I had hoped. I wanted to find things that would keep her hands busy without her getting into trouble by being destructive, which has been a problem. I guess her breaking these is a better alternative than her peeling the paint off of our walls again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and satisfying fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: These little things are fantastic. I know it's a fad to have things to fiddle with, but these Tangle Jr's are so silky smooth and delightful to manipulate. There's just something about the way they move that is so engaging and satisfying, I carry one in my pocket, keep one on my computer desk and one on the coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: Whedon

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: So far, these appear to be well made for the cost and are great for helping students/kids focus and calm themselves. It's a quiet fidget toy that they can use anywhere, even in the classroom when allowed. Since receiving these, I find myself using them as well. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. You can interchange the colours which is a bonus, it’s just very difficult to do so. It requires a lot of strength but pieces can be reassembled. This is a nice little fidget toy for any ages. There is some mild noise when the pieces click together but that’s only audible if you’re in a very quiet space
customer_reviews.author: Coo

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I had some of these when I was little and so I bought these for my nephews they loved them! I would honestly purchase them again
customer_reviews.author: Sar21

customer_reviews.title: One of the best fidget toys
customer_reviews.text: My students love this fidget toy. They can take it apart and combine them all together, which is one of the best features of this fidget. It also works well for my students with anxiety or student who struggles to express themselves.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Survived a middle school room
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the few tools that have survived in my classroom. Works well though the kids like to take all the pieces apart
customer_reviews.author: T. Moes

customer_reviews.title: but I actually find them a bit too distracting to be useful for my ADHD
customer_reviews.text: These things are OK, but I actually find them a bit too distracting to be useful for my ADHD. My perfectionism always wants to get them back into their rolled-up shape, with the piece that has the logo printed on as the top loop that goes over the whole thing in the end. WAY too distracting! :)
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great for stress and focus
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw these, I wasn't sure how they would be for an adult. However, I thought I would give them a try. I'm glad I did. I currently have a job where I sit for hours and watch a screen. These help me stay focused and keep me from getting side tracked. They are so much fun to play with and they make a boring job go quickly. They also help me not get stressed.
customer_reviews.author: Annalisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Vegetable part of the scene
customer_reviews.text: Update: This set was/is an odd purchase. Initially, a big hit, but the popularity faded, and these would be left in the "kids" kitchen drawer. But surprisingly enough, these have become "fruit/vegetable plants" for the dinosaurs & dragons, when playing at the kitchen table! This is a classic "ask no questions, enjoy the happiness" moment, with the kids :)
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex "Gas"osaurus

customer_reviews.title: Can't return!
customer_reviews.text: This was not what I wanted and they won't let me return it. They are too small, too smooth, and don't move or crackle like the one the counselor had that my daughter liked. It is ridiculous that i cannot return a product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really like these
customer_reviews.text: These are great to keep in the car and for watching movies. My kids are fidgeters when watching tv... so they tend to pick if their hands aren't busy. (Trichotillomania, anxiety, etc.) These help from time to time. Better to have than not. We have learned that they can pop apart. One link broke, but we just popped it out and reattached. Would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: totallyweezul

customer_reviews.title: We have these in our "calm down" areas and the kids love them! They have been especially great for some ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a daycare and have some kiddos who just need to fidget! We have these in our "calm down" areas and the kids love them! They have been especially great for some of my more aggressive boys, fidgeting with these seems to help them relieve some of their tension and really works at calming them down! These are also great at nap time for my kids that don't nap. These are quiet and keep them entertained for a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for self regulation
customer_reviews.text: These held up really well in our school calm down corners. Elementary school students can be really hard on different materials and I was really impressed by these.
customer_reviews.author: cara rodman

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy!
customer_reviews.text: My little guy (2 years old) loves twisting and moving these toys around. My only complaint is that it was far too easy to pull it apart!
customer_reviews.author: Emily E.

customer_reviews.title: Relaxing, fun & durable
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to these things, but I keep one in my desk and I like to tinker with it while on the phone. I find it relaxing. Everybody seems to want to play with it!
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Wrong colors
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t receive the colors I ordered, which was frustrating because my students specifically wanted the one that was reminiscent of the trans pride flag. Regardless, a tangle is a tangle no matter the colorway.
customer_reviews.author: Dipple McShittington

customer_reviews.title: Great for anxiety
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my daughter with anxiety. Her counselor recommended she have one in her pocket and these are the perfect size for that.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador Jane

customer_reviews.title: everyone should have one!
customer_reviews.text: colors match the photos. they stay tightly linked but work perfectly in the hand! I like to snap these onto my backpack, purse, anywhere that could make sense and be available. I highly recommend these to anyone who might move or fidget or whatever you could need! most of my friends or people i’m around really find it soothing when I have let them use it.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer hubbs

customer_reviews.title: Great for anxiety and fidgeting
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty terrible anxiety and these are great for the times that my mind is racing and when I'm needing something to do with my hands. Fidgeting with these helps to keep me calm. I keep one at my desk, one in my car and carry the other in my purse. Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: GhostGirl785

customer_reviews.title: Hours of enjoyment, perfect for my autistic son and younger daughter.
customer_reviews.text: Great quaility! Perfect for my autistic son and younger daughter. Hours of enjoyment and distractment at church.
customer_reviews.author: Carlee

customer_reviews.title: I have gone through several of these fidget toys due ...
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several of these fidget toys due to my students using them so much. They are totally worth it, and provide more help with anxiety and stress in class (get a couple different ones so they can make larger chains.).
customer_reviews.author: bluealderfer

customer_reviews.title: Good for anyone who is on long conference calls or ...
customer_reviews.text: Quiet fidget toys and high quality. Good for anyone who is on long conference calls or just likes to have something to "fidget" with in hand...better than spinners! (The schools will appreciate you if you get these instead.)
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: I also think this might be useful for someone with arthritis in order to gain or ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my seven year old who has been having a hard time sitting still at school. She's very active and having problems getting through her day. I plan to give another one to my son's friend who is recovering from a broken wrist. I think it should help him regain his range of motion. I also think this might be useful for someone with arthritis in order to gain or maintain mobility. It's very soothing to play with.
customer_reviews.author: marialouise808

customer_reviews.title: Great Fidget Idea, Quality Lacking
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the quality of two of them so far. We have messed with these at another person's home and really loved them. Got these and within minutes one is popping apart and now a second one is popping apart. For now they snap right back together, but we did not experience this with the others we had messed around with in the past and I expect the knobs will only handle the constant pressure for so long before breaking off.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fidget!
customer_reviews.text: We got these for my 11-year-old son for Christmas. He drives my 8-year-old crazy because he's always tapping things and bouncing. We purchased a few different "fidgets," and he thinks this one is by far the best. He LOVES it and takes it with him the the car, uses it around the house, and is excited to take it to school. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t plan on joining these together
customer_reviews.text: Good fidget toy. However when I tried to put them together I had a hard time getting one section together without another section becoming disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: PetRescuer

customer_reviews.title: Broken pieces right away.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing present. Tangle Jr The ends of the little pieces broke off inside the pieces next to them rendering both pieces useless. Eight pieces have broken so far while using them and while trying to take them apart.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Stress Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I am an adult, and have had this toy for close to 10 (adult) years! It has come with me through 3 different jobs, and I always introduce it as "My favorite stress toy". It is true. It is simple and perfect for distracting you from those stressful moments at work. I have since purchased several for co-workers/friends. It seems so simple/silly but I highly recommend to kids and adults alike!
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: These are the greatest things!
customer_reviews.text: These are the greatest things!!! My son has mild ADD and they have been perfect for him! He sat and played with it for 2 hours straight! He keeps it in his pocket and every now and then I see him get it out and play with it. :) He is in 2nd grade and takes it to school...he gets to play with it as his 'reward' for completing his work!! Such a simple thing has been a treasure in our lives!!
customer_reviews.author: 3 BOYS...AHHHH!!

customer_reviews.title: They break easily.
customer_reviews.text: One of the tangles broke on the first use. They pop out of the socket and it’s very difficult to put them back together.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Red

customer_reviews.title: do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter saw these on TV and wanted them so i purchased. Honestly, do not waste your money. This came in a set of 3 and even 2months later she didn’t even open two of them. She maybe played with the one for about 5min and lost interest and never touched it again.
customer_reviews.author: ADMPmommy

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: My son is on the spectrum and thoroughly enjoyed these. Awesome stocking stuffers too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Sensory Toy Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 6 year old who has ADHD. I was a little concerned at first because there isn't much that holds his interest. He took one to school, and his teacher came up to me and raved about it. She said it kept his hands occupied, and he was able to focus much more, all while playing with the tangle. I'm super happy with this purchase (and I even use one myself) Great product.
customer_reviews.author: #Pet Stylist

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: So fun, I love tangles! They’re sturdy and last quite a while. Great tools for anyone with ADHD or anxiety.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Christine Milbrandt

customer_reviews.title: Great for ADHD
customer_reviews.text: Both my son and my fiance love these things because they both have ADHD so not just for kids either. Adults can enjoy this
customer_reviews.author: Max DR

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return this product.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot return these? I missed that notation when placing the order. This product is not what I expected. They look like a great toy for those who would not put them in their mouths. However, my father has dementia and would take them apart immediately. They would be a choking hazard. Lesson learned: always read the good and bad reviews in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SMH Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fidgit Toy
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Grandbabies Christmas Stockings and they Love them. They're 9 & 11 & really like them. Wouldn't recommend for Toddlers as these can be snapped apart. This Grandma finds herself playing with them alot too!!
customer_reviews.author: KymKC

customer_reviews.title: Good for all ages
customer_reviews.text: These are fun to play with, and also good stress relievers. I use them myself sometimes, especially when i want my football team this year... my 16 month old daughter loves them, the 3rd-6th graders I work with love them, and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really love playing with these
customer_reviews.text: I really love playing with these, I work on the phones and they keep my hands busy, but after 3 days, one of them had broke. I didn't mind at first as i could just re-link it together without the broken piece. An hour later another piece broke off and it kept on breaking. I was quite disappointed in how easily it was breaking apart. Overall good fidget toy, but not very durable. :/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised how much adults and the college kids love them. Got one guy to stop biting his ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an ADD teenager with anxiety who wanted one. Have since ordered more because people are always asking where I got them. Surprised how much adults and the college kids love them. Got one guy to stop biting his nails and fidgeting by carrying one in his pocket all the time.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: The picture made these look like they came in separate boxes
customer_reviews.text: The picture made these look like they came in separate boxes. I gave them to my three kids as gifts, so I repackaged them, but I would have preferred the separate packaging. They are small, but as a fidget toy, the size is fine for little fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: It's very nice and relatively easier to put back together than these ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of the artist creations tangles and received it before these. It's very nice and relatively easier to put back together than these ones are. I received two that aren't all together with the pieces at the bottom of the package. I tried to put them back together but it's seemingly impossible to do so with these.
customer_reviews.author: MJObession

customer_reviews.title: Best portable fidget toy
customer_reviews.text: Love my tangle fidgets. I find them really comforting and take them to doctor's appointments and to meetings and just about everywhere. These are the best because the surface is flat - I had one of the bumpy, textured ones when I was younger and found that they really hurt my hands as a person with sensory issues, but the plain ones are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Stress relief
customer_reviews.text: Great fidget toys, for adults as well. My own mother took one to work, and she used it throughout the day. It seems to really help relieve stress. It does break apart somewhat easily though. It snaps back in, but some pieces can be a real pain to try to put back together. I had originally purchased these thinking my toddler would love it, but now it's become more for us adults :)
customer_reviews.author: Caspergirl92

product_meta.title: TANGLE Set of 3 Jr. Original Fidget Toy
product_meta.description: Color:As ShownTangles are based on the concept of infinity and continuous motion. This Magic in the Motion that you feel when you play with a Tangle is truly therapeutic and calming to the soul. Once you put a Tangle in your hand, you just can not put it down. A Tangle is more than just a toy. It is twistable energy that enables a flow of creativity from your mind. Technically, a Tangle is a series of 90 degree curves, connected and able to pivot at each joint. It has no beginning and no end just continuous motion. Tangles have endless uses and serve a variety of different purposes. It can be a puzzle, a movable sculpture, a desktop toy, a fidget, a brain tool, an anti stress device, a teacher supply, or even a cosmic art toy with special powers. The possibilities are limitless. Tangles are fun to look at, fun to hold, fun to twist, turn, and manipulate. They are appealing to all ages, to boys and girls alike, and even adults. They offer a hands on art experience that brings out creativity and artistic imagination while also being silent and calming. They do not disturb or disrupt others. Safe, reusable, and affordable, Tangle toys come in a wide array of patterns, colors, and types for different age groups.
feature_bullets: GET CREATIVE: Tangles are the perfect way to express your creative side in a whole new light. Attach them however and mold them into whatever you'd like.
KEEP BUSY: If you or your child can't stand sitting with idle hands, this is the perfect solution for waiting rooms and car rides alike. Super fun and super portable.
CRAZY COLORS: This pack comes with three different color schemes of Tangle Jr. All of which are bright and fun. Mix them together to make them even more exciting.
PUT DOWN THE ELECTRONICS: If you're trying to get your child away from a tablet or phone, this is a great non distruptive solution to your gadget problem.
QUALITY MADE: Tangles are meant to be taken apart, put back together, and used over and over so they've been made to the highest standards so you can get use after use out of them.
